article: How to Respond to “Green Flags I Look For” on Hinge
intro: So, you’re creating your Hinge profile when the prompt “Green flags I look for…” pops up. How should you answer it? What response will attract the most attention? Let’s start with what green flags are: positive things you want in a relationship.

steps.title: Hint at your interests to make an instant connection.
steps.subtitle: Who says your answer to the prompt has to be serious? Be a little silly and have fun with it! Think about your goofiest and strangest obsessions or hobbies. Then, note them in your response. After all, people want to learn more about you.
sub-points: “Can down a pint of ice cream in 5 minutes.”

sub-points: “Can down a pint of ice cream in 5 minutes.”

steps.title: List things you want to see in a potential life-long partner.
steps.subtitle: If you’re using Hinge to find your soulmate, don’t be afraid to detail your future goals and lifelong dreams. Maybe you want lots of kids or would love to travel with them. Hint at these in your profile to capture the person of your dreams.

steps.title: Describe how you are in a relationship.
steps.subtitle: Give them a taste of what you’re like in a relationship to make them laugh and/or start a conversation. Think about what your green and red flags are. Then, hint at them in your response. This is an excellent way to be cute and quirky.

steps.title: List some of your flaws to get them to laugh.
steps.subtitle: The beautiful thing about Hinge is that it can be completely candid! Don’t let up when describing yourself. If there are things past partners have told you are downright ridiculous, include them (while being sensible, of course). This showcases your personality and gives them a heads-up right away.
sub-points: “Can make a decent meal (because I can’t).”

points.name: “Agrees that Despicable Me is a masterpiece.”

steps.title: Pinpoint a niche topic to get them talking.
steps.subtitle: Is there a movie, topic, or debate you just love to get on your soapbox about? If so, put it in your bio! Answering the prompt this way can capture people’s attention, whether they agree with you or not. It’s a great conversation starter.
sub-points: “Thinks reputation is Taylor Swift’s best album.”
“Believes Jack and Rose could’ve both fit on the door.”
“Likes drinking orange juice after brushing their teeth.”

steps.title: Name a basic skill to lower the stakes.
steps.subtitle: Make them laugh with something simple practically everyone can do. You can be extra silly and absurd or throw in an endearing remark. Either way, this is an awesome way to highlight your sense of humor while being cute.

steps.title: Keep it simple with ideal personality traits.
steps.subtitle: You likely know what you want in a partner—there’s an ideal personality! Use this Hinge prompt to detail what you hope they have. Think of it like a job interview. What must they have in order to be your significant other? Try using these words to start:

steps.title: Use physical traits to find your dream partner.
steps.subtitle: Close your eyes and think about your perfect partner. There are likely a few discernible traits, right? Don’t be embarrassed—we all have a type! Draw out a person who looks just like your dream partner with a few physical traits you’d love them to possess.

steps.title: Be flirty by highlighting your kinks.
steps.subtitle: If you’re feeling frisky, drop a few hints at what you like doing in the bedroom. This is a great way to find someone with the same sensual interests as you and highlight that you’re looking for someone who can give you a good time.
sub-points: “Likes to do it once a night.”
